Title.evidence: This study sought to determine if intraoperative methylprednisolone during neonatal cardiac surgery is associated with neurodevelopmental outcomes at 12 months of age

Trial_Design.evidence: A planned secondary analysis of a two-center, double-blind, randomized, placebo-controlled trial

Intervention.evidence: randomized, placebo-controlled trial of intraoperative methylprednisolone in neonates undergoing cardiac surgery

Objective.evidence: This study sought to determine if intraoperative methylprednisolone during neonatal cardiac surgery is associated with neurodevelopmental outcomes at 12 months of age

Method_Outcome.evidence: Bayley Scales of Infant and Toddler Development-III (BSID-III) were performed at 12 months of age

Number_Randomised.evidence: There were 129 participants (n=61 methylprednisolone, n=68 placebo)

Result_Outcome.evidence: There were no significant differences in BSID-III scores and brain injury biomarker levels between the two treatment groups
